brief.brief: The display attribute number corresponding to the Attribute signal you want to use.

Attribute signals cause the terminal to display a field with varying kinds of highlighting, intensity, color, etc. You can also use Attributes to set graphic symbols and other special characters depending upon the device's capabilities.

detail.detail: All termtype entries require at least four (4) attributes:
- Attribute Setting 1, for data entry or input fields (usually normal intensity)
- Attribute Setting 2, for label or output fields (usually background intensity)
- Attribute Setting 3, for error or key fields (usually highlighted in some way)
- Attribute Setting 4, for system fields (usually low lighted in some way)
Service Manager stores these settings stored in array entries 2 through 5; entry 1 stores the default background setting. Entries 6 through n are optional.
Use only attributes 1 or 3 for input fields on forms for 3270-type terminals. All other values are protected field settings.
